When importing SQLite databases it is extremely important to know that it will overwrite your current database. All local changes will be lost forever. The file that will be imported needs to be on your SD card as "mileage.db"

Importing comma-separated value (CSV) files is useful for providing spreadsheet integration. Note that the format is pretty specific; if you are not sure of the format, it's highly recommended that you export a CSV, open it in Excel, insert your values, and then import the resulting spreadsheet. Note that the input file needs to be on your SD card as "mileage.csv"

Importing SQL is highly dependent on the database schema. If you do not know what you're doing with this, it is recommended you use another option. The file that is imported needs to be on your SD card as "mileage.sql"
Exporting the SQLite database will create a direct copy of your current SQLite database and place the resulting copy on your SD card in the file "mileage.db"
Exporting a comma-separated value (CSV) file will export your current database into a "mileage.csv" file on your SD card. This file can then be used in Excel or any other spreadsheet editor.

Exporting your database as SQL will create a "mileage.sql" file on your SD card. These SQL commands can then be imported into any other database engine of choice, provided that the schemas match. Note that the table-creation SQL is omitted; it is up to the end user to create the necessary tables.
From this screen, you can add a new vehicle, or select an existing vehicle to edit.

From here, you can change attributes about an existing vehicle. If you decide to not save your changes, simply select Cancel Changes to undo the changes. Note that there must always be at least one vehicle, so you can not delete the last vehicle. If you have multiple vehicles, you can choose to set this vehicle as default, so that it is always first in the list.

This allows you to add new vehicles to your database. This may be helpful if you drive two vehicles, or multiple vehicles share a database. You can optionally set this vehicle to be the default vehicle.

This allows you to add a new fill-up into the database. Note that you can select any date you wish, so you can enter past fill-ups. Alternatively, you can import old fill-ups from a spreadsheet or database; go to History, then to Import/Export for more details. You can fill in an optional comment.
The history browser lets you view a list of past fill-ups, of all vehicles. Once a fill-up is selected, you can edit or delete individual entries. Additionally, you can import or export data.

From here, you can edit a previously-recorded fill-up, or delete it altogether. Select Cancel Changes to undo any changes you have made and return to the history browser. You can fill in an optional comment, if you want to.
